instruction: As a real estate investor, you are looking to benchmark your portfolio. Based on the article, what are some factors to consider when selecting a benchmark?
output: When selecting a benchmark for your real estate portfolio, it is important to consider factors such as your investment objective, investment strategy, and capacity to invest directly in assets. Depending on these factors, different benchmarks may be more appropriate, such as a broad-market benchmark or a more focused peer-group benchmark. Investors may also consider the level of resource intensity required for benchmarking and the strength of governance and inclusion rules for peer-group benchmarks. Ultimately, selecting the right benchmark is crucial for providing analytical insight at each stage of the investment process.
